abstract: Pluspetrol, the Argentine energy company, has reopened an oil field in Peru’s northeastern Amazon region as violent clashes between police and members of the local indigenous community subsided. The company said Block 1-AB in the Loreto department was operating normally. Pluspetrol had suspended operations at Block 1-AB, which accounts for most of Peru’s oil output, on Thursday after protesters demanding higher salaries for local Pluspetrol workers stormed the installations. The clashes with police grew violent, and one officer was killed and five were wounded.
lead_paragraph: Pluspetrol, the Argentine energy company, has reopened an oil field in Peru’s northeastern Amazon region as violent clashes between police and members of the local indigenous community subsided. The company said Block 1-AB in the Loreto department was operating normally. Pluspetrol had suspended operations at Block 1-AB, which accounts for most of Peru’s oil output, on Thursday after protesters demanding higher salaries for local Pluspetrol workers stormed the installations. The clashes with police grew violent, and one officer was killed and five were wounded.
